summary: A bug in the unionfs dependency caused a company-wide outage for users of @temporalio/worker due to an unpinned transitive dependency. The discussion explores whether pinning dependencies is the right approach to prevent similar issues.
userImpact: Users experienced production outages when indirect dependencies introduced breaking changes, making the SDK unusable.
rootCause: Unpinned transitive dependency (unionfs ^4.4.0) allowed broken releases to be installed, causing module resolution failures.
proposedFix: Consider pinning all direct dependencies to exact versions, though this may not prevent transitive dependency issues; alternatively, users can vendor the SDK using package-lock.json.
workaround: Users can vendor the Temporal SDK and its dependencies locally by pointing to packages in a local directory, or use package-lock.json to lock transitive dependencies.
resolutionDetails: Determined that pinning dependencies would cause more harm than benefit to the community. Recommended solution is for users to vendor the SDK if they need strict dependency control.
keyQuote: This sdk is a core piece of infrastructure and should not suddenly break when indirect dependencies are updated.
